sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"小说，故事"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: novel, romance, fiction, story, fable, tale
means: novel ： 指任何有情节、人物、对白，虚构的长篇散文体故事。
romance系novel早期的代用词，泛指具有强烈神话和传奇色彩的故事，现指爱情故事。
fiction ： 指部分或全部虚构的短篇、中篇、长篇小说，也指传奇故事，是小说的总称。
story ： 指篇幅较短，常包含一系列情节或事件，口述或书写成文的故事。
fable ： 指短小而寓有教育意义的虚构故事。故事的主人公多为拟人化的动物或非动物之类。也作传说解。
tale常可与story换用，指以事实为中心作叙述的故事，也指古代流传下来的传说故事或神话故事。

sentence.Network_en: Producers decided to end her on-screen romance with Pierce Lawton.
sentence.Network_cn: 制片人决定结束她在影片中与皮尔斯·劳顿的恋情。

sentence.Network_en: She loved him so much: it was a fairytale romance.
sentence.Network_cn: 她深深爱着他：这是个童话般的浪漫故事。

sentence.Network_en: It is ridiculous to suggest we are having a romance.
sentence.Network_cn: 暗示我们正在谈恋爱的说法真是太荒谬了。

means.word_mean: 传奇,冒险故事,恋爱故事

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Romance, originally denoting a composition in the vernacular as opposed to works in Latin. Early use denoted vernacular verse on the theme of chivalry; the sense 'genre centred on romantic love' dates from the mid 17th cent

entry.def: A romance is a relationship between two people who are in love with each other but who are not married to each other.

example.ex: After a whirlwind romance the couple announced their engagement in July.
example.tran: 在闪电式的恋爱后，两人在7月宣布订婚。

entry.def: Romance refers to the actions and feelings of people who are in love, especially behaviour which is very caring or affectionate.

example.ex: He still finds time for romance by cooking candlelit dinners for his girlfriend...
example.tran: 他仍然会找时间为女友准备烛光晚餐，制造浪漫。

example.ex: He takes a rather sceptical view of love and romance.
example.tran: 他对爱情和浪漫持非常怀疑的态度。

entry.def: You can refer to the pleasure and excitement of doing something new or exciting as romance .

example.ex: We want to recreate the romance and excitement that used to be part of rail journeys.
example.tran: 我们想再度营造以前坐火车旅行的浪漫和兴奋。

entry.tran: 爱情故事;爱情小说;爱情电影
entry.def: A romance is a novel or film about a love affair.

example.ex: Her taste in fiction was for chunky historical romances.
example.tran: 她所喜欢的小说是大部头的历史爱情小说。

entry.def: Romance is used to refer to novels about love affairs.

example.ex: Since taking up writing romance in 1967 she has brought out over fifty books.
example.tran: 自1967年开始写爱情小说起，她已经出了50多本书了。

entry.tran: (中世纪的)冒险故事，传奇文学
entry.def: A medieval romance is a story about adventures such as battles and long journeys.
When a man romances a woman, he has a love affair with her.

example.ex: He has romanced some of the world's most eligible women.
example.tran: 他已经和一些非常适合结婚的女人谈过恋爱了。

entry.tran: 罗曼语系的（由拉丁语演变而成的语言，如法语、西班牙语、意大利语等）
entry.def: Romance languages are languages such as French, Spanish, and Italian, which come from Latin.

means.word_mean: 2. an exciting and mysterious quality (as of a heroic time or adventure)
4. a novel dealing with idealized events remote from everyday life
3. talk or behave amorously, without serious intentions;

sentences.sentence: "The guys always try to chat up the new secretaries"
"My husband never flirts with other women"
"This author romanced his trip to an exotic country"

auth_sentence.res_content: The eighteenth century suspected all poetry, romance...and enthusiasm.

sentences.en: Jane's and Paul's life together is full of romance.
sentences.cn: 简和保罗的共同生活充满了浪漫色彩。

means.word_mean: 爱情小说, 浪漫故事

sentences.en: She wrote a romance about an artist's life in Tokyo.
sentences.cn: 她写了一个关于一位艺术家在东京生活的浪漫故事。

jushi.english: There was an air of romance about the old inn.
jushi.chinese: 这家老客栈有浪漫气氛。

jushi.english: Those young girls like to read romances.
jushi.chinese: 那些年轻女孩爱看爱情小说。

jushi.english: A romance happened in his family.
jushi.chinese: 他家里发生了一件风流韵事。
